data.enText: being careful about what you say or do, especially to avoid danger or mistakes; not taking any risks
He was very cautious about committing himself to anything.
data.chText: 他谨小慎微，从不轻易表态。

data.enText: The government has been cautious in its response to the report.
data.chText: 政府对此报道反应谨慎。

data.enText: They've taken a very cautious approach .
data.chText: 他们采取了十分谨慎的态度。

data.enText: They expressed cautious optimism about a solution to the crisis.
data.chText: 他们对解决危机持谨慎的乐观态度。

data.enText: She looked cautiously around and then walked away from the house.
data.chText: 她先小心地环顾了一下四周，然后才离开了房子。

data.enText: A cautious person is nervous that something may be dangerous or unwise, so they only do it very slowly or after a lot of thought. (opposite = rash )
data.chText: cautious指人因担心某事危险或不明智而缓慢行事或小心谨慎。（反义词为rash）

data.enText: A careful person is not nervous but does take extra care to make sure that everything is correct or nothing goes wrong. (opposite = careless )
data.chText: careful指人并非担心害怕，但为确保万无一失而做事小心仔细。（反义词为careless）

data.enText: Be careful / Take care when you drive on icy roads.
data.chText: 在冰霜覆盖的道路上驾驶时要小心。

ex.enText: It might be prudent to get your parents' opinions before you make the final decision.
ex.chText: 作最后决定之前问问你父母的意见兴许更稳妥。

ex.enText: My suggestion is that you should talk with the prudent house buyers.
ex.chText: 我的建议是你应该和谨慎的购房者聊聊。

synonyms.bx: 指明智而谨慎的，尤指避免不必要的风险，不贸然行事。

ex.enText: He is the most careful driver she has ever met.
ex.chText: 他是她见过的最谨慎的司机。

ex.enText: The waiter was being very careful with the soap so as not to spill it.
ex.chText: 服务生拿汤的时候很小心，怕把汤泼出来。

synonyms.bx: 指非常小心的，力求避免做错事或造成损失。

ex.enText: All sides have expressed cautious optimism about the announcement.
ex.chText: 与会各方都对这项通告表示谨慎乐观。

ex.enText: The government has taken a cautious approach to the crisis.
ex.chText: 该政府采取了谨慎的态度处理危机。

synonyms.bx: 既可指人谨慎细心的，也可指态度、批评方式等经过仔细考虑的，目的在于避开危险或风险。

synonym.guide: 导航词义：谨慎的，小心的

tr: people who are fearful and cautious
example: whitewater rafting is not for the timid

example.ex: The scientists are cautious about using enzyme therapy on humans...
example.tran: 科学家们对在人身上使用酶疗法非常慎重。

example.ex: He is a very cautious man.

value.def: Someone who is cautious acts very carefully in order to avoid possible danger.

example.ex: David moved cautiously forward and looked over the edge...
example.tran: 戴维小心翼翼地往前挪，从边缘向下张望。

example.ex: Cautiously, he moved himself into an upright position.
example.tran: 他小心翼翼地直起了身子。

example.ex: He has been seen as a champion of a more cautious approach to economic reform.
example.tran: 人们一直将他视为主张更为谨慎的经济改革措施的提倡者。

value.def: If you describe someone's attitude or reaction as cautious, you mean that it is limited or careful.

example.ex: I am cautiously optimistic that a new government will be concerned and aware about the environment...
example.tran: 对于新政府是否会关注环境问题，我持谨慎的乐观态度。

example.ex: Rebel sources have so far reacted cautiously to the threat.
example.tran: 到目前为止，反叛分子面对威胁的反应非常谨慎。

partsOfSpeech.dec: caut 小心 + -ion 行为,状态
de- 完全,加强 + lic- 诱惑 + -ious ...的
re- 表强调 + lig 捆绑 + -ious ...的
amb- 两 + it- 行走 + -ious ...的
con- 共同,一起 + sci 知道 + -ent  ...的 + -ious ...的
